JobFullDesc: Systems Administration EngineerThe ability to drive human progress through technology relies on robust and reliable IT infrastructure – and that’s what our IT Infrastructure team provides to our customers. We’re a team of experts optimizing the performance and integrity of IT infrastructure and ensuring consistency and synchronization across all infrastructure components. Alongside supporting new and existing applications, we work with other IT groups and business units to troubleshoot and resolve technical problems.Join us as an Systems Administration Engineer to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact on our Platform Engineering Services team in Digital IT Engineering.What you’ll achieveAs an Systems Administration Engineer you will have the ability to provide expertise to ensure holistic support, proactive monitoring, and overall health of IT applications, IT tools, infrastructure (hardware, data, software), security, information access, system performance and data integrity. Provide technical expertise in cross-functional and intra-departmental efforts. Participate in root-cause analysis of technical incidents.  You will:Recognize and troubleshoot technical problems within acceptable service levels. Monitor and react to output from tools and systems. Depending on priority and complexity of the incident, will escalate or troubleshoot accordingly.  Communicate with cross-functional teams, primarily at the individual contributor level, to provide problem resolution updates. Ensures incident information is accurate before escalating to other teams.  Utilize external and internal resources, including teammates, to investigate technology and build knowledge. Regularly contributes to departmental documentation and knowledge bases. Understands and leverages technical and incident communication structure; may be asked to participate in cross-functional teams.  May work on multiple problems or projects simultaneously depending on complexity.  Participate in process and technical improvements to the IT environments and overall customer experience.  Be familiar with ticketing systems, such as ServiceNow and participate in an on-call rotation schedule ("follow the sun" model)Take the first step towards your dream careerEvery Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:Essential RequirementsMinimal of 5+ years experience in Microsoft Windows Administration (2019 / 2016 / 2012 Server ) and Linux System AdministrationExpertise in Troubleshooting Operating systems with knowledge of Clustering, DHCP/DNS/AD Mgmt Virtualization  - VMware ESXi, vCenter, vMotion, DRS, HA  Performance Management and Disaster Recovery Practices  Desirable RequirementsKnowledge or experience in Networking & Storage concepts (SAN/NAS ), Dell -Hardware and/or Cloud Technologies  - Private, Public, Hybrid Here’s our story; now tell us yoursDell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.
